Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Shaun M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after spending 4 nights in a Holiday Inn downtown San Diego and found this far better value (free car parking, free breakfast, nicer room). The bed was comfortable, the room airy and clean and the shower had good pressure. There was free wi-fi available also, which was useful. We were happy here and would recommend it for anyone visiting San Diego on vacation as long as you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Kazoo_Bruce
Reviews.Content: This is a very convenient location with a excellent restaurant and bar next door (Elephant Bar). This is now a Holiday Inn Express, no longer a Holiday Inn as of January 2012, even though it is still listed as a Holiday Inn. The property has been recently remodeled and the breakfast only restaurant, has been converted to a HIE eating area. This is a new conversion so not everything is to HIE standards, namely there were no cinnamon rolls or the new pancake machine. The staff is good, and they made the effort to bring me a new room key when mine didn’t work. I didn’t have to slog up to the desk or wait long for the bell man arrival. The rooms are average, and the TV has poor reception on some stations, but they have been upgraded to flat screens so it was acceptable but not ideal. The bathroom had two lotions and shampoo instead of conditioner, shampoo, and lotion. I didn’t find this out till I was already in the shower. Just a little disappointment, but a easy oversight by the staff. Again I have found that the bathroom central exhaust is not functioning. It leads to steamy showers, and in wet climates mold. But in this area since it’s so dry the only downside is steamy showers. Good property and will improve after the complete transition.

Reviews.Title: “Road noise, but nice otherwise”
Reviews.Author: TatilSeverUS
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks a bit old from the outside, but the room we stayed at was very clean and fairly large with a nice sofa. The furniture was old fashioned, but in good shape, with just a few nicks and scratches here and there. The room got a good amount of daylight thanks to the sliding door into the little balcony. (Not every room has the same floorplan though. I saw one with a small living area with the daylight perpetually blocked by the bathroom.) No dusty or moldy smell that I sometimes get even in some well known chains. The road noise is quite loud, but it was acceptable if I keep the sliding door closed. I can stay here again, but I cannot say I loved it. We definitely prefer the Hilton Garden Inn on the other side of the freeway. It is definitely more elegant. The furniture there is more modern and they have a nice reception area with high ceilings, a fireplace and comfy couches. Holiday Inn was undergoing renovations when we stayed there and it seemed they are replacing the furniture. I think our room was among the old ones. Fortunately, we did not hear any construction noise, except in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Rancho Benardo Road”
Reviews.Author: wescravn
Reviews.Content: This hotel, if you can call it that is interesting. I have stayed here on business and can say it is the worst POS hotel in the US. Yes, its bad folks. WHy? 1) Horrible Service 2) Overcharges 3) Incompetent Staff 4) Noisy Rooms 5) Outdated 1960's decor 6) The list goes on and on. This hotel (motel) might be good for some people wanting a one-star hotel, and no frills, nothing fancy. I need a place to lay my head. I would recommend elsewhere. I got there and they didn't even have my room folks please. I could really rip this hotel apart for the stuff that went down, but I'm warning you if you're coming from out of town, don't stay here. Staying on the street would be about the same experience. It's horrible. No one can actually justify giving this more than one star. The price is the only thing saving it, and even that's not a consolidation.

Reviews.Title: “Good--bridges the gap between motel and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karim040
Reviews.Content: It was a little more than I wanted to pay, but that's because it's so close to all these corporations here and gets business travelers whose companies foot the bill. Weekend rates are predictably lower. Nice underground parking for security of belongings, I like that they had a laundry room. Internet is free though far from speedy. Very well appointed rooms, very clean, good smelling, and comfortable. Friendly staff, some of whom appeared to be young foreign trainees who aren't afraid to play a joke on me (I called from my room to confirm they had me reserved for a second night, and she said no...and after I started to panic a little she said 'just kidding!' -- kind of a risky trick to play but I thought it was funny). My only complaint is that the walls (or ceilings, I can't tell which) are shockingly thin. I could hear furniture being moved, vacuum cleaners, some conversation. It wasn't that bad in the sense that it didn't happen much--the guests here don't make much noise, but it was louder and clearer than I expected when everything else here was so well-done.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Moliscious
Reviews.Content: My stay at this facility was AWESOME....not only did I enjoy the rest but Mr. G and his entire staff were very courteous. They went above and beyond....when I needed a ride, towels, or anything. I recommend anyone to stay here. Thank you Mr. G and the entire staff. Maurice J.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ac_braden
Reviews.Content: I needed a local hotel at short notice; I checked a few in the area including the Raddisson, Hilton and where we stayed the Holiday Inn all in Rancho Bernardo (we needed to be close to a famly member living locally) All hotels were minimum $130 per night and we needed it for 3 weeks; I used Hotwire and got the Holiday Inn for an excellent rate of $69 per night!!! We stayed in room 220 close to the pool on the second level. The hotel was very clean and tidy; the staff were always friendly and our house keeper Christina was always great at her job and ensured we had plenty of supplies. Most rooms have a balcony looking over the carpark; it's great to get fresh air too. The location is convenient to the freeways and local shopping. Downtown was 35 minutes with a good run. We rarely went down town; for the zoo and a musuem or two; this area has alot to explore so worth a week if you used it for a base. The area Rancho Bernardo is very safe; infact it's surroundings are very well kept and the parks and walkwlays are pleasant to stroll around etc. There's a Elephant bar next door and hooter just up the road; also a short stroll finds a CVS and Taco Bell. I'd recommend this hotel as a great base; we had a great stay; mum, dad & 2 kids under 6 were comfortable here for 3 weeks! We didn't ever have breakfast at the restaurant as it was an extra cost and Denny's was better value. The pool and spa was a highlight; both heated and great for an easy family activity; the gym was basic but good for a business traveller. Good luck with your choice in RB.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarshallGulch
Reviews.Content: I am in Rancho Bernardo for a Hospice situation and can't stay at the house. So This will be my 3rd week at this hotel. I joined the Priority Club for the frequent travelers. And that has given me free breakfast buffet. Plenty of excellent food, From eggs, bacon, ham and fruit to cereals and miso soup and rice and oatmeal. More choices than I need. That actually saves me $15.00 a day at Cocos for the two of us for breakfast. That $$ really adds up. The staff is excellent, greetings on arrival and departure. The room is excellent. They gave me a internet rate due to my situation. Thank you Thank you. As I write this I am preparing to go back for another week from Tucson. We will do this a week at a time. They also have a nice pool, walled in with a spa. D/n use it . High marks for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good -- Good staff”
Reviews.Author: NaguKanamarlapudi
Reviews.Content: I was there in this hotel more than 10 days on my business trip. I feel it is cool and well maintained. I much satisfied with staff and management team. It is good and price competitive in that surroundings

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on Box Springs!”
Reviews.Author: broncodevil
Reviews.Content: We were to stay at the Holiday Inn Rancho Bernardo for 4 nights and we wound up leaving after one night!. The beds were so hard that we woke up in the middle of the night with back pain. After further investigating the "mattress" was made of metal coils that were cold in the night. We ran the heater and it was as loud as a jet engine. We booked our stay with Orbitz so my first thought was that they give the bad rooms to the Orbitz people. I asked the night crew to show me some other rooms to check the beds to see if any of them were any softer. They were all the same!...... We go to a lot of hotels and have slept in many different beds, but these were unbearable. Thank goodness there was a Radisson across the street with sleep number beds.......they saved our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not 3 star. Needs repairs.”
Reviews.Author: desertdog999998
Reviews.Content: We rented this room on Hotwire, where you don't know what hotel it is until you pay for it. Previous hotels have been great so we weren't worried. We wanted the area to be close to family and still close to San Diego Zoo, beaches, etc. The other comments on parking are true, but there is a one level garage under the second building next door. Large SUV's won't fit there though. The main building looks like it was added on to 2 or 3 times, at the end. You would walk down the long hallway and pass through narrow doorways and the construction materials (ceilings, etc) would be slightly different. We were at the end of the main hall on the 2nd floor in the non-smoking section. Some of the rooms had an interior stairway to a second level for a private bedroom (we peeked in one that was being cleaned after check out). Our room was one level and actually quite large, but the attached photos will show the water damage to the wall and ceiling. Another ceiling tile in the bathroom area was also water damaged and slightly askew. Also, most electrical outlets were so loose that the plugs for hair dryers, laptop chargers, etc would actually fall out of the outlet. We had to jiggle them and sometimes prop the plug so that it would stay in the outlet. That shows a lot of use, and the outlets should be changed. The A/C is a "central" type, with a vent coming out of the wall above the entry way. This vent could not be adjusted, so the bed closest to the bathroom was in the warmest part of the room. Thankfully we always bring a small fan for the "white noise" and it circulated the air enough for us. I can certainly understand the complaints about the air flow. The A/C thermostat was very irritating. It is computerized, and the programs can't be changed. The program was set for 76 during the day and 80 DEGREES at 10 pm. No matter how I tried to adjust the programming it would not eliminate the 10 pm meltdown. You could adjust the temperature but it reverted back to broil at 10pm. After 10 minutes of messing with it I did manage to find the "hold" function so that the thermostat would hold the temp at a set number. I chose 75 and it held it at that. As a back up measure, I changed the time on it by 12 hours, so that if the damn thing did go to 80 degrees it would do so during the day when we were either gone or awake and could override it. Doing these two things allowed us to be comfortable while we slept but it is stupid to program it at 80 degrees in the first place. Once we got past the ceiling cracks and the weird A/C settings the hotel was okay. Not 3 stars, unless they are very dim stars way far away in another galaxy, but okay. I am glad that I only paid $85 a night through Hotwire, I would be very upset to pay their standard rate of $135 or more for what we got. The towels were very absorbant, but not very soft. Sort of like a free dermal abrasion treatment. I didn't mind, but just wanted to note it. There were also plenty of them. We had no problem with noise or other guests. We were on vacation so we slept in past the free breakfast, but the one time we saw it the room was full and everyone looked to be enjoying it. Overall, an okay hotel. Better than Days Inn, etc. but not a good value at full rate. Stay there if you like the area and can get a good rate, otherwise there are other newer hotels around that are probably in better shape.

Reviews.Title: “A Fair Hotel...For A Fair Price...”
Reviews.Author: SURFINFAMILY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after searching hotels in San Diego and finding very few available rooms and fair rates. I will start by saying that the area is great. It is right up the freeway from everything and really close to The San Diego Wild Animal Park. It is in an upper middle class neighborhood and I felt really safe. It is next door to the Elephant Bar Rest. The staff were nice and I am a stickler for smiles and greetings. The parking is tight but free and we always managed a spot to park our larger vehicle. The room is simple but has a small fridge and micro. We are traveling with kids so having the fridge made a big difference. The beds were ok. Maid service was terrific but the carpet was very dirty as our socks were black on bottom. The satellite TV we had was also free but in the rare days we came back early the signal was weak and went out a few times. The free breakfast was a toss up with my husband and I having different views. The choices were good for a free meal, eggs and bacon/sausage and muffins and fruit rolls, oatmeal juices boxed cereals coffee etc.. By the way the rating is A ( I always look for that too) however... you have to get there early as they close up shop promptly at 9 am and you have to rangle a free table. Be prepared (especially if you have kids) to wait for a while for someone to finish their meal and run like heck to claim the table while the busboy is trying to bus the table. I did not like that but my husband loved it. He remarked that the food was terrific! It saved our family at least $30.00 a day ...The plates are glass ... there are no waiters and no host. We did not try the pool as hubby is picky about pools. I would say that if you go thru Priceline you can get a great rate and for the money this place is worth it. We just really needed a central place to sleep while on our visit to San Diego. Its not the ritz but hey nobody bugs you for tips and you can spend the money you save on lodging for other fun things in san Diego. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great free breakfast - Very good value”
Reviews.Author: ndprius
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after a wedding right up the street. Check in went smoothly, the room was great with free internet & a small refrigerator but the real value came with the breakfast - full eggs, sausage, cereals, fruit, juices etc like at the Embassy Suites. I don't know how they do it in this day & age of food inflation. We saw families of 6 in the dining room. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My friends say this place is "nothing special"”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: I was up the road in San Marcos visiting a friend who has had business meetings here. Her words were "Oh--*that* hotel; it's nothing special." I have to agree. For example, my laptop can't print, and I had to print an html document. I phoned the desk to ask where the business suite was. The clerk answered "What's that? What's a business suite?" I walked to the front desk and explained what I wanted. The clerk pointed to a computer in the corner for guests to use. That was the business suite. We're adjacent to the I-15 freeway, and I'd venture to say 99% of the traffic here is one night stay drive-off - drive on. My jet engine-sounding air conditioner and the jitterbugging young-people upstairs trying to cave in my ceiling make this a poor man's business hotel. But it's clean and smells nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Area”
Reviews.Author: mkramer27
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to this location on business. It is a beautiful area to visit and mostly residential. The hotel was clean and very nice. One negative I found is that the hotel is actually two separate buildings. The one I stayed in did not appear to have great wheel chair access near the lobby which means carrying your luggage up stairs or walking a great distance in the parking lot to get to the other building. My recommendation would be to request a room in the same building as the lobby. This building is also where the breakfast is served. Other than that, it was a great hotel/stay. There is a restaurant behind the hotel which has a nice sit down area and/or bar scene. The front desk of the hotel has a 15% off coupon that you can use there too.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Vacationgirl_0707
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what the other reviewers were expecting, but this hotel met all my expectations. We only had a one night stay, but everything was as it should be. The check in and check out processes went very smoothly. The front desk staff were very helpful with whatever we needed. The rooms were big and clean with a small sofa and coffee table. Our room even had a nice little balcony with chairs. They even have an underground parking area. Oh yeah, the breakfast was great! They had a wide variety of breakfast items from cereal and waffles to eggs and sausage and several juices. The only thing I could even think to say bad would be that the shower head could stand to be replaced. Overall, it was a pleasant stay and I would have no problems staying there again. It is what you should and would anticipate for a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what a hotel should be - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: DadoFour
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. For the price it is above average, I have definitely paid more for less. I can't think of anything to complain about. I gave above average because the breakfast was fantastic, the pool had a jacuzzi, the view was nice, the service was good. Don't hesitate a second, unless you are expecting a 4 star hotel, if you anticipate a 2.5 star you will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Angie55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Rancho Bernardo for three nights in July 2007. My first night, I set the air conditioning at 70 because the room was very warm. At midnight, I woke up and the temperature read 89 degrees. I contacted the front desk, and they moved me to a different room. The next two nights, the exact same thing happened. The room never got any cooler than 85 degrees - it was much cooler outside than it was in my hotel room! Another thing - I left laundry at the front desk at 8am on my second day. They told me it would be ready by 6pm that evening. The next morning, I STILL had not received my laundry back, despite several phone calls inquiring about my clothing. At noon the following day (after several phone calls), my clothes were finally delivered, but no explanation was given. The room itself was fine. Fairly clean, but not new. The bathroom was clean, but the towels were very thin and small. It was a noisy hotel. There were several families staying, and you could hear the kids running up and down the hall. You could also hear the doors slamming at night and in the morning. Overall, I would not stay here again. The major deal breaker for me was the room temperature. Who wants to stay in a hotel that is so hot? It didn't make for a comfortable night sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Business Persons Hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfjr
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel frequently because it is inexpensive and does meet my needs as a business traveler. I have to work in the Rancho Bernardo area twice a month so I've tried a few other hotels. This is a typical Holiday inn. The rooms have free Hi speed Internet service and there is a computer and a printer near the front desk. Good for printing out boarding passes. Otherwise, the beds are good, the showers are good and the TV worked. I seldom want more when I'm only in the room for sleeping. Oh,t he breakfast is included and again is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Garbage breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: kevgy
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the impressive photos on the web site which are a totally different hotel (you will pass it on the way from the airport). Found the room to be ok (standard drab american decoration) with in-room beverages limited to the ubiquitous coffee; no alternative of tea. There's a noisy fridge in the room, but if you want to get some sleep, you have to turn it off. If you enjoy eating off plasic plates with plastic cutlery, this is the place for you. Well, that's if you have a robust palate. Don't expect a great variety buffet breakfast. Scrambled egg looked distinctly like silicone rubber to me and on the first morning, I'm sure it had a peculiar green tint and I didn't fancy the other v.limited choice of hot food either. Not much in the way of healthy eating. The impressive variety of fruit around the yoghurt turned out to be plastic decoration, but we did get fresh bananas 2 mornings out of 4. Unfortunately, if you want a proper breakfast, you have to drive. The wifi signal is weak and was off-air every night from around 23:30 to 07:30.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Softail
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the business traveler with lots of the usual amenities including the Elephant Bar right next door. I've been a regular guest here since January 06 and have found the Staff working the front desk to be very friendly and very professional. If the room is missing something or something's not quite right, they are very quick to correct the problem. The included breakfast buffet in the morning is also very good. I would recommend staying here whether on business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Made me never want to stay at a Holiday Inn Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family traveled to San Diego in August 2005. We arrived to check in to the Holiday Inn at 17065 W Bernardo Dr and found the staff very short and unfriendly. As we waited to be served another person was complaining that his air was not working(it was hot that day). They told him they would send someone to fix it. This had us worried already. Well we get to the room, entering through underground seedy garage up to our suite!(well I would not call it a suite)Walked down the hall could hear everybody making noise in their rooms. As we walked on the gross carpet down the hall with no air but a window opened. Opened the door to a dark cave where there was a couch ,tv and table. To our delight, not there was a terrible smell and of coarse the air was not working! Well was not happy so phoned down to the front desk to ask to change rooms. But, of coarse we were told they were sold out! Our family had just traveled all day and wanted to relax in cool air. This had us so mad we went into the lobby and used the payphone to call other hotels however there was something big in town and could not find a room. So we decided to stay just 2 nights and not 5 and did the whole San Diego in a day. Later that night when trying to sleep you get to hear the patio and the cars coming and going form the pub across the way which they give you coupons for. Finally get to sleep and was awaked by the room next door Father was having a arguement with his daughter which school to go to. This was through the adjoining door at 12am. When we checked out I told the front desk staff everything and they did not care! Our family travels about 6 weeks a year and we will not stay in a Holiday Inn again! I wanted to write this because I use Tip adivsor before every trip and find it a great tool.Thank-you for having such a useful site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay for the money! We not only had a great, clean room but they also added a free breakfast buffet and free wine/beverage during happy hour. The staff were awesome. Very, very friendly and accomodating! This was well worth the money. I will definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: dmills1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 15th. Had a room on the 2nd floor. Parking is very limited. Had to park behind the Elephant Bar and Restaurant after the hotel front desk staff assured me that it was OK. Morning breakfast was great. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Counterweight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Holiday Inn for two nights on a long weekend getaway. We got a good price via Priceline, it was a convention weekend so all the hotels closer to San Diego were booked. The hotel itself is fine, exactly what you'd expect from a typical Holiday Inn. The room was clean and the desk staff were friendly, the breakfast was nicer than expected. We focused most of our activities around the downtown area, it was a good 30 minute drive to get there from the hotel. This is a decent place to stay if you want to be outside the city; If you want to play in the city, I'd look for something closer than the Rancho Bernardo area.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn San Diego-Rancho Bernardo
HotelInfo.Address: 17065 W. Bernardo Dr., San Diego, CA 92127
